Class PlayerState

java.lang.Object
model.game.PlayerState
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class PlayerState extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a serializable snapshot of a player's state at a specific moment in the game. This class is used for saving and loading game states, capturing all relevant information about a player including their cards and identity.

This class implements Serializable to allow game state persistence.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerState

      public PlayerState(Player player)
      Constructs a PlayerState snapshot from a Player object. Creates a deep copy of the player's jest collection and offer array to preserve the state at the moment of creation.
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose state is being captured

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of the player.
      Returns:
      the player's name

    • getJest

      public ArrayList<Card> getJest()
      Gets the collection of cards in the player's jest pile.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the cards in the jest pile

    • getOffer

      public Card[] getOffer()
      Gets the array of cards the player is currently offering.
      Returns:
      an array of cards in the player's offer

    • isAI

      public boolean isAI()
      Checks whether this player is controlled by AI.
      Returns:
      true if the player is an AI, false if it's a human player
